intro: Collomia atacamensis, commonly known as the Atacama lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Atacama Desert in Chile. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant has adapted to extreme drought conditions through its deep root system and succulent leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
